00018 // Registering with the jcom.hub object
00019 t_object *jcom_core_subscribe(t_object *x, t_symbol *name, t_object *container, t_symbol *object_type)
00020 {
00021         if(max5){
00022                 t_object        *patcher = container;
00023                 t_object        *box;
00024                 t_symbol        *objclass = NULL;
00025                 t_object        *hub = NULL;
00026                 
00027         again5:
00028                 box = object_attr_getobj(patcher, gensym("firstobject"));
00029                 while(box){
00030                         objclass = object_attr_getsym(box, gensym("maxclass"));
00031                         if(objclass == ps_jcom_hub){
00032                                 hub = object_attr_getobj(box, _sym_object);
00033                                 object_method(hub, ps_subscribe, name, x, object_type);
00034                                 return hub;
00035                         }
00036                         box = object_attr_getobj(box, gensym("nextobject"));
00037                 }
00038                 patcher = object_attr_getobj(patcher, gensym("parentpatcher"));
00039                 if(patcher)
00040                         goto again5;
00041 
00042                 return NULL;
00043         }
00044         else{
00045                 t_patcher       *p = (t_patcher*)container;
00046                 t_box           *b;
00047                 t_class         *theclass;
00048                 t_object        *hub = NULL;
00049                 
00050         again:  
00051                 for(b = p->p_box; b; b = b->b_next){                                                    // traverse the linked list of boxes in the patch
00052                         if(b->b_firstin && ((t_object*)(b->b_firstin))->o_magic != 1758379419){
00053                                 error("jamoma_core_subscribe: something has gone terribly wrong");
00054                                 post("maybe you have multiple modules with the same OSC name?");
00055                                 return NULL;
00056                         }
00057                         theclass = object_class(b->b_firstin);
00058                         if(object_classname_compare(b->b_firstin, ps_jcom_hub)){        // if this is a jcom.hub...
00059                                 object_method(b->b_firstin, ps_subscribe, name, x, object_type);
00060                                 hub = (t_object*)b->b_firstin;                                                  // store the pointer
00061                                 break;                                                                                                  // then stop looking
00062                         }
00063                 }
00064                 if(hub == NULL){                                                        // failed to find a hub in the patch...
00065                         if(p->p_vnewobj != NULL){                               //      go one level higher and search there
00066                                 b = (t_box *)p->p_vnewobj;
00067                                 p = b->b_patcher;
00068                                 goto again;
00069                         }
00070                         else
00071                                 error("object named '%s' could not find a jcom.hub for subscribing", name->s_name);
00072                 }
00073                 return hub;
00074         }
00075 }
00076 
00077 // Unregister from the jcom.hub object
00078 //void jcom_core_unsubscribe(void *hub, t_symbol *name)
00079 void jcom_core_unsubscribe(t_object *hub, void *object)
00080 {
00081         if(hub)
00082                 object_method(hub, ps_unsubscribe, object);
00083 }

00086 #pragma mark -

00089 // Copying all of the elements should be faster than branching and copying one element
00090 //      (that's the theory anyway...)
00091 void jcom_core_atom_copy(t_atom *dst, t_atom *src)
00092 {
00093         //      memcpy(dst, src, sizeof(t_atom));
00094         sysmem_copyptr(src, dst, sizeof(t_atom));
00095 }

00098 bool jcom_core_atom_compare(t_symbol *type, t_atom *a1, t_atom *a2)
00099 {
00100         if(!a1 || !a2)
00101                 return 0;
00102                 
00103         if(type == ps_msg_float){                               // float is first so that it gets process the most quickly
00104                 if(atom_getfloat(a1) == atom_getfloat(a2))
00105                         return 1;
00106         }
00107         else if((type == ps_msg_int) || (type == ps_msg_toggle)){
00108                 if(atom_getlong(a1) == atom_getlong(a2))
00109                         return 1;
00110         }
00111         else if(type == ps_msg_symbol){
00112                 if(atom_getsym(a1) == atom_getsym(a2))
00113                         return 1;
00114         }
00115         else if((type == ps_msg_generic) || (type == ps_msg_list)){
00116                 // type msg_list should be checked here as well.  If type == msg_list and this function is called
00117                 // it means we are dealing with a list of length 1, so we only need to compare one atom anyway.
00118                 
00119                 // note that if the two are of different types, then they are obviously not the same
00120                 if((a1->a_type == A_LONG) && (a2->a_type == A_LONG)){
00121                         if(a1->a_w.w_long == a2->a_w.w_long)
00122                                 return 1;
00123                 }
00124                 else if((a1->a_type == A_FLOAT) && (a2->a_type == A_FLOAT)){
00125                         if(a1->a_w.w_float == a2->a_w.w_float)
00126                                 return 1;
00127                 }
00128                 else if((a1->a_type == A_SYM) && (a2->a_type == A_SYM)){
00129                         if(a1->a_w.w_sym == a2->a_w.w_sym)
00130                                 return 1;
00131                 }
00132         }
00133         else
00134                 error("atom_compare: cannot do comparison on this data type");
00135         return 0;
00136 }

00139 void jcom_core_file_writeline(t_filehandle *fh, long *the_eof, char *the_text)
00140 {
00141         char    tempstring[4096];
00142         short   err = 0;
00143         long    len = 0;
00144         
00145         strcpy(tempstring, the_text);
00146         strcat(tempstring, "\n");
00147         len = strlen(tempstring);
00148         err = sysfile_write(*fh, &len, &tempstring);
00149         if(err){
00150                 error("jamoma: sysfile_write error (%d)", err);
00151                 return;
00152         }
00153         *the_eof = *the_eof + len;
00154 }

00157 // Compare Strings: Is s2 after s1 in alphabetical order?
00158 bool jcom_core_string_compare(char *s1, char *s2)
00159 {
00160         short i;
00161         short len1 = strlen(s1);
00162         short len2 = strlen(s2);
00163         bool result = false;
00164         bool keepgoing = true;
00165         
00166         if(len2 < len1)
00167                 len1 = len2;    // only compare the characters of the short string
00168                 
00169         for(i=0; i<len1 && keepgoing; i++){
00170                 if(s1[i] < s2[i]){
00171                         result = true;
00172                         keepgoing = false;
00173                 }
00174                 else if(s1[i] > s2[i])
00175                         keepgoing = false;
00176         }
00177         return result;
00178 }

00181 // Load an external for internal use
00182 // returns true if successful
00183 bool jcom_core_loadextern(t_symbol *objectname, long argc, t_atom *argv, t_object **object)
00184 {
00185         t_class         *c = NULL;
00186         t_object        *p = NULL;
00187 
00188         c = class_findbyname(ps_box, objectname);
00189         if(!c){
00190                 p = (t_object *)newinstance(objectname, 0, NULL);
00191                 if(p){
00192                         c = class_findbyname(ps_box, objectname);
00193                         freeobject(p);
00194                         p = NULL;
00195                 }
00196                 else{
00197                         error("jamoma: could not load extern (%s) within the core", objectname->s_name);
00198                         return false;
00199                 }
00200         }
00201 
00202         if(*object != NULL){                    // if there was an object set previously, free it first...
00203                 object_free(*object);
00204                 *object = NULL;
00205         }
00206 
00207         *object = (t_object *)object_new_typed(CLASS_BOX, objectname, argc, argv);
00208         return true;
00209 }

00212 // Function the translates a Max path+filename combo into a correct absolutepath
00213 // TODO: remove this function once we've completed the transition to Max5, as path_topathname() is fixed for Max5
00214 void jcom_core_getfilepath(short in_path, char *in_filename, char *out_filepath)
00215 {
00216         char    path[4096];
00217         
00218         path_topathname(in_path, in_filename, path);
00219 
00220 #ifdef MAC_VERSION
00221         char *temppath;
00222         temppath = strchr(path, ':');
00223         *temppath = '\0';
00224         temppath += 1;
00225 
00226         // at this point temppath points to the path after the volume, and out_filepath points to the volume
00227         sprintf(out_filepath, "/Volumes/%s%s", path, temppath);
00228 #else // WIN_VERSION
00229         strcpy(out_filepath, path);
00230 #endif
00231 }

00234 // Add attributes that are common to many subscribers (such as parameter, message, and return)
00235 void jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_common(t_class *c, t_object *attr, long offset, bool define_name)
00236 {
00237         long            attroffset;
00238 
00239         // METHODS
00240         class_addmethod(c, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_hubrelease,     "release",              A_CANT, 0);     // notification of hub being freed
00241         class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,                         "dumpout",              A_CANT, 0);  
00242         class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,                        "quickref",             A_CANT, 0);
00243 
00244         // ATTRIBUTE: name
00245         if(define_name){
00246                 attroffset = offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common, attr_name);
00247                 jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "name", _sym_symbol,
00248                         (method)jcom_core_subscriber_attribute_common_setname, (method)jcom_core_attr_getname,
00249                         attroffset);
00250         }
00251 }

00253 
00254 void jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_extended(t_class *c, t_object *attr, long offset, bool define_name)
00255 {
00256         long            attroffset;
00257 
00258         jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_common(c, attr, offset, define_name);
00259 
00260         // ATTRIBUTE: range <low, high>
00261         attroffset = offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_range);
00262         jamoma_class_attr_array_new(c, "range/bounds", _sym_float32, 2,
00263                 (method)jcom_core_attr_setrange, (method)jcom_core_attr_getrange,
00264                 offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_range_len), attroffset);
00265 
00266         // ATTRIBUTE: repetitions - 0 means repetitive values are not allowed, 1 means they are
00267         attroffset = offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_repetitions);
00268         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "repetitions", _sym_long,
00269                 (method)0, (method)jcom_core_attr_getrepetitions,
00270                 attroffset);
00271 
00272         // ATTRIBUTE: type 
00273         // this is not defined here because some objects (i.e jcom.parameter) need to treat this in different ways
00274         
00275         // ATTRIBUTE: clipmode - options are none, low, high, both
00276         attroffset = offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_clipmode);
00277         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "range/clipmode", _sym_symbol,
00278                 (method)0, (method)jcom_core_attr_getclipmode,
00279                 attroffset);
00280 
00281         // ATTRIBUTE: description - does nothing, but is accessed by jcom.dispatcher for /autodoc generation
00282         attroffset = offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_description);
00283         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "description", _sym_symbol,
00284                 (method)0, (method)jcom_core_attr_getdescription,
00285                 attroffset);
00286 }

00289 // arg is subscriber name
00290 void jcom_core_subscriber_new_common(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x, t_symbol *name, t_symbol *subscriber_type)
00291 {
00292         t_atom  a;
00293         
00294         x->subscriber_type = subscriber_type;
00295         x->custom_subscribe = NULL;
00296         x->hub = NULL;
00297         x->obj_hub_broadcast = NULL;
00298         x->module_name = _sym_nothing;
00299 
00300         // we call the function directly here rather than use object_attr_setvalueof() 
00301         // because parameters with pattr bindings don't actually have their own 'name' attribute
00302         atom_setsym(&a, name);
00303         jcom_core_subscriber_attribute_common_setname(x, NULL, 1, &a);
00304         
00305         x->container = jamoma_object_getpatcher((t_object*)x);
00306         
00307         // set up the jcom.receive the listens to broadcast messages from the hub
00308         atom_setsym(&a, ps_jcom_broadcast_fromHub);
00309         if(!jcom_core_loadextern(ps_jcom_receive, 1, &a, &x->obj_hub_broadcast))
00310                 error("jcom.core: loading jcom.receive extern failed");
00311         else
00312                 object_method(x->obj_hub_broadcast, ps_setcallback, &jcom_core_broadcast_callback, x);
00313         
00314 }

00317 void jcom_core_subscriber_new_extended(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended *x, t_symbol *name, t_symbol *subscriber_type)
00318 {
00319         jcom_core_subscriber_new_common((t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *)x, name, subscriber_type);
00320         
00321         x->attr_range[0] = 0.0;
00322         x->attr_range[1] = 1.0;
00323         x->attr_clipmode = ps_none;
00324         x->attr_description = _sym_nothing;
00325         x->attr_type = ps_msg_generic;
00326         x->attr_repetitions = 1;
00327 }

00330 // function for registering with the jcom.hub object
00331 void jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x)
00332 {
00333         if(x->hub == NULL){                     // do not allow multiple subscribes of this object 
00334                 x->hub = jcom_core_subscribe((t_object*)x, x->attr_name, x->container, x->subscriber_type);
00335                 if(x->hub) 
00336                         x->module_name = (t_symbol *)object_method(x->hub, ps_core_module_name_get);
00337                 if(x->custom_subscribe)
00338                         x->custom_subscribe(x);
00339         }
00340 }
00341

00343 // Notification that the hub no longer exists
00344 void jcom_core_subscriber_hubrelease(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x)
00345 {
00346         x->hub = NULL;
00347 }

00353         x->custom_subscribe = meth;

00357 // Unsubscribe and common freeing code
00358 void jcom_core_subscriber_common_free(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x)
00359 {
00360         jcom_core_unsubscribe(x->hub, x);
00361         x->hub = NULL;
00362         object_free(x->obj_hub_broadcast);
00363         x->obj_hub_broadcast = NULL;
00364 }

00367 // receive messages from our internal jcom.receive external
00368 void jcom_core_broadcast_callback(void *z, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00369 {
00370         t_jcom_core_subscriber_common   *x = (t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *)z;
00371         
00372         if(msg == gensym("hub.changed"))
00373                 defer_low(x, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe, 0, 0, 0);
00374 }

00377 // COMMON ATTRIBUTE: name
00378 t_max_err jcom_core_subscriber_attribute_common_setname(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00379 {       
00380         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00381         x->attr_name = arg;
00382 
00383         if(arg->s_name[strlen(arg->s_name)-1] == '*')
00384                 x->has_wildcard = true;
00385         else
00386                 x->has_wildcard = false;
00387 
00388         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00389 }

00391 t_max_err jcom_core_attr_getname(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00392 {
00393         *argc = 1;
00394         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00395                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom));
00396         atom_setsym(*argv, x->attr_name);
00397 
00398 //      jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00399         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00400 }

00403 // We are using a custom setter here because relying on the offset seemed to cause memory corruption
00404 // This was the easiest way to avoid that.
00405 t_max_err jcom_core_attr_setrange(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00406 {       
00407         if(argc)
00408                 x->attr_range[0] = atom_getfloat(argv+0);
00409         if(argc > 1)
00410                 x->attr_range[1] = atom_getfloat(argv+1);
00411         
00412         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00413 }
